intro: Helixanthera rubristaminea, commonly known as the red-stemmed helixanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking red stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
